name: LifePlanner
tags: weekly vertical coilbound classic 12-months 12-months-plus dated medium customizable 50-70 monday-start
extras: Goodie pack: 20% off coupon, gift labels, compliment cards, circle label
pageBreakdown: Perhaps one of the most prolific layouts in the planner sphere, the Erin Condren Vertical layout features a uniquely stacked weekly view. Each day is separated vertically into three cards, often with built-in dividers and a single small section for notes underneath. There is also dedicated space for notes next to the vertical weekly layout, which starts on Monday.
Bulletin-style monthly notes before month’s start, standard lined notes at month’s end
Weekly pages with a Monday start
shortDescription: The weekly vertical LifePlanner is a classic agenda with a twist - it features vertically stacked daily columns that you can use to break up your days however you choose.
description:
The weekly Erin Condren Vertical LifePlanner is a comprehensive classic agenda with a twist - it features vertically stacked daily columns that you can use to break up your days however you choose.

This best-selling coiled planner includes yearly overviews, monthly spreads, and (of course) the unique Monday-start weekly pages.

Fans of the brand will know that these planners especially shine in style and customization. Erin Condren has an excellent in-house design team that collaborates with brands like Sanrio to create planner covers for a wide range of styles. Additionally, these covers are customizable. Whether you want to design a collage cover yourself or just add your initials to a pre-styled one, there are several paths to choose from.
pros: Cover customization provides a great way to express yourself through an item you’ll use every day
LifePlanners contain 80lb Mohawk paper, which is soft, thick, and can handle a variety of pens and markers
Tons of accessories available for purchase that go with the planner, plus even more made by small planner businesses
cons: Erin Condren planners typically run on the pricier side, with the LifePlanner starting at $55 before any customization
While there are a ton of cover customization options to choose from, the interior designs are often limited to just a few selections
Coilbound design doesn’t allow for swapping pages in and out. Those looking for a more flexible experience should look into the LifePlanner Binder
goodToKnow: If you love the Erin Condren look and brand, but aren’t crazy about the vertical layout, you can opt for a horizontal, daily, or hourly layout instead.
Since the vertical LifePlanner is so popular, you can find a massive variety of stickers specifically made for this layout ranging from free to deluxe by small business on Etsy.
If you want to skip customization and get a planner quickly, you can often find Erin Condren planners and accessories on Amazon Prime.
bottomLine: The Weekly Vertical LifePlanner is a great option for those looking for yearly, monthly, and weekly planning, all conveniently wrapped into one notebook. At 7"x9", it’s the perfect size for a large tote or bookbag and, despite using a heavy paper type, the planners don't feel too bulky to carry daily. The LifePlanner is also a fantastic option for those new to planning who want to jump in right away, as well as for experienced planners who want to decorate to their heart’s content.

There is also dedicated space for notes next to the vertical weekly layout, which starts on Monday.
Bulletin-style monthly notes before month’s start, standard lined notes at month’s end
Weekly pages with a Monday start
shortDescription: The weekly Vertical LifePlanner Binder is a classic agenda with a twist - it features vertically stacked daily columns that you can use to break up your days however you choose and comes in a ring binder.
description:
The weekly Vertical LifePlanner Binder is a classic agenda with a twist - it features vertically stacked daily columns that you can use to break up your days however you choose and comes in a ring binder.

This best-selling layout includes yearly overviews, monthly spreads, and (of course) the unique Monday-start weekly pages.

While the LifePlanner Binder doesn’t have as wide a range of designs or customization options, the ability to add initials in gold, silver, or rose gold foil is still there.
pros: The sturdy ring binder design means that your pages stay safe and well-protected inside your bag
LifePlanners contain 80lb Mohawk paper, which is soft, thick, and can handle a variety of pens and markers
Tons of accessories available for purchase that go with the planner, plus even more made by small planner businesses
cons: The binder design utilizes a unique hole-punch style, so you will need to purchase a compatible hole-punch to add pages

The same in-planner extras that come with the coilbound LifePlanner come with the ring binder version as well, but are not hole-punched to fit inside the binder
goodToKnow: If you love the Erin Condren look and brand, but aren’t crazy about the binder format, you can opt for a coilbound weekly vertical, hourly, or horizontal layout instead.
If you want to skip customization and get a planner quickly, you can often find Erin Condren planners and accessories on Amazon Prime.

As mentioned in the ‘cons’ section above, the included sticker sheets and extra folder are coil-punched to fit inside a coiled planner, but not hole-punched to fit inside the ring binder. That means, in order to keep all your goodies together, you’ll have to purchase the specific hole punch for this planner, which is disappointing for a company known for its high-quality planners and extras.
bottomLine: The LifePlanner Binder is an excellent choice for those who love the size and layouts of Erin Condren planners and want the ability to add/remove pages at will. With the ring binder design, you can simply purchase packs of pages to refill it, as well as many custom pages/planners made by small businesses (as long as you purchase the special hole-punch required).

name: Vertical Hourly
tags: weekly hourly vertical coilbound classic 12-months 12-months-plus dated medium large customizable 30-50 monday-start 20-30
customization: Cover text, cover photo, year display, customized layouts
pageBreakdown: The Vertical Hourly layout from Plum Paper is an hourly weekly layout where each weekday has its own column broken down by the hour. These columns are made up of 12 (customizable!) hours with two lines each and a blank section at the bottom for notes or a list. To the left of each week are a small monthly calendar and a long column with a to-do list and additional space for notes. This format is ideal for those who like to plan their days by the hour while also seeing their full week-at-a-glance across two pages.
Yearly overview, event list, and goals
Dot grid notes, contacts, password tracker, holiday pages, and next year-at-a-glance pages
shortDescription: The Plum Paper Vertical Hourly is an all-in-one planner with yearly, monthly, and detailed weekly planning by the hour. This layout features (customizable!) 12-hour blocks for each day.
description:
The Plum Paper Vertical Hourly is an all-in-one layout with yearly, monthly, and detailed weekly planning. This layout features (customizable!) 12-hour blocks for each day. Fans of the Erin Condren vertical hourly style will love Plum Paper’s more affordable and more customizable layout.

Speaking of customization, this is where Plum Paper really shines. In addition to cover personalization options, Plum Paper lets you customize several aspects of your planner’s layout overall. That means whether you want the hours to run from 5 am or 11 am, they can (and it’ll only cost you a few bucks more)!

In addition to the weekly spreads, there’s also plenty of space for monthly planning, yearly planning, and goal setting.
pros: Customizable hours let you break up your days exactly how you need them
There are several different vertical (and horizontal) layouts to choose from in three different sizes: 7x9, Letter, and A5
Much more affordable than a comparable Erin Condren vertical planner with far more personalization options
cons: Doesn’t offer as many extras (stickers, etc) as other planner brands
Only two choices of internal color schemes (as of Nov. 2020): colorful and neutral
There is an option to receive your planner in loose pages, letting you add them into a ring or disc binder of your choice, but the brand doesn’t offer a physical ring binder or discs at the moment
goodToKnow: There are a variety of customizable layouts across multiple sizes and formats, making this one of the most tailored pre-made planners on the market.
Each planner features a heavy-duty (and rip-proof!) cover, with a glossy clear plastic protector over both back and front.
Erin Condren-sized vertical stickers will fit this planner, but with a tiny bit of overhang on each side.
bottomLine: This is a fantastic planner overall, especially for those who want an hourly layout that is tailor-made just for them. With the layout customization options paired with the gorgeous cover designs, fonts, colors, sizes, and affordable prices, the Plum Paper planner is an excellent option for a planning newbie and veteran alike.

name: Horizontal

size: Mini (5.12 in x 7.13in), Medium (7.5in x 9.25 in), Large (9in x 11.5in)
pageBreakdown: Recollections planners feature interiors that are tailored to the size of the planners. By selecting the Mini size, the horizontal daily sections will be blank. In the Medium size, you’ll have lined daily sections with a colorful banner next to each day. In all sizes, the Spiral Planner features a place for notes and full-sized sections for each weekend day, which is a huge plus, as many horizontal planners opt to have Saturday and Sunday combined with a half-section each.
Built-in folder and extras (Medium and Large only)
shortDescription: This Spiral Planner is a thoughtfully designed classic agenda for comprehensive monthly and weekly horizontal planning.
description:
The Recollections Spiral Planner is a thoughtfully designed classic agenda for monthly and weekly planning with a horizontal layout. No matter the size you choose, the horizontal spread utilizes the layout well to ensure you have plenty of space for functional planning. These planners are often seen as direct competitors to brands like The Happy Planner and Erin Condren.

Recollections offers their spiral-bound option in a ton of different cover designs, with similar interiors. In Medium and Large, each month can have an accent color featured on the colorful daily banners and dashboards. On the Mini (and some Medium and Large planners), the interior theme is monochromatic on all pages.
pros: Good use of functional planning space across all sizes
Great selection of designs and styles every year
Varying interior schemes (colorful or monochromatic) in Large and Medium planners
cons: The mini size only comes with one small sticker sheet, while other sizes provide four
Certain interior schemes are only found with certain cover designs
Recollections is a Michael’s brand, so the planners can only be found at Michael’s
goodToKnow: The Mini and Medium sizes are both compact enough to fit into a purse or book bag, while the large is fairly bulky and not travel-friendly.
These planners can often be found on sale throughout the year, even during big planner-buying seasons
Depending on the year the planner is released, Recollections typically feature only one coil color. 2021 planners have a golden coil.
bottomLine: If you’re looking for a solid monthly and weekly planner with a horizontal layout, the Recollections Spiral Planner is a great choice. This is even more true if you like coilbound planners but aren’t a fan of other coilbound brands like Erin Condren or Plum Paper.

pageBreakdown: The horizontal Happy Planner’s weekly spread gives each day and a notes section about ¼ page of lined planning space. Each month features a monthly dashboard with sections for notes and dates in addition to a traditional calendar spread.
shortDescription: The horizontal Happy Planner is a discbound option that features comprehensive monthly and weekly spreads with a lined horizontal layout.
description:
MaMBI’s horizontal Happy Planner is a discbound option that features comprehensive monthly and weekly spreads with a lined horizontal layout. Happy Planners are much-loved in the planning community for how easy the brand makes it to customize your planner. Thanks to their disc system, you can add, rearrange, and remove planner pages and accessories to make a planner that is uniquely your own.

Happy Planners come in a variety of cover designs, interior page schemes, and disc types, and there are three sizes available: Mini (5.1in x 8.6in), Classic (8.75in x 9.75in), and Big (10.1in x 11.5in).
pros: Disc system allows for a ton of personalization without the hassle of a bulky ring binder
Tons of cover designs and disc colors to choose from
Available at most big-name craft stores and on Amazon, in addition to MaMBI’s own site
cons: Happy Planners don’t come with any extra/bonus items, which is rare for planners at their price point
There is only one note page, located at the back of the planner
Some planners are inconsistently labeled, so the planner you buy based on an in-store label may not be the one you intended to bring home
goodToKnow: If you want to add pages to your planner, you’ll need a hole-punch specifically made/sized for these planners.
As mentioned above, Happy Planners only include one note page per planner. They do, however, offer note inserts through their shop.

Also mentioned above, some planners have a label correctly identifying the version of the planner you’re buying. Some, however, don’t—even for the same planner. Both a Classic and Big ‘Good Habits’ vertical Happy Planner were purchased for PlannerDB, yet only one identified itself as the guided version, while the other was labeled as a standard option. If you’re shopping in-store, make sure to flip through the planner before buying.
bottomLine: If you want a versatile planner that you can customize from top to bottom without a ring mechanism, the Happy Planner is a great choice. This is especially true if you’re thinking of switching from a horizontal and coiled brand like Erin Condren planners.

name: Happy Planner Good Habits
tags: weekly vertical guided discbound classic 12-months dated medium large 30-50 monday-start 20-30
pageBreakdown: The vertical Happy Planner’s weekly spread gives each day and a notes column about ¼ page of sectioned vertical space. Each month features a monthly dashboard with sections for notes, dates, and intentions in addition to a traditional calendar spread. What makes the Good Habits version special, is its inclusion of guided prompts meant to help you be your best self and meet your goals. These prompts are found throughout the planner’s functional spreads.
shortDescription: The Good Habits Happy Planner is a discbound option that features goal-setting prompts, trackers, and weekly spreads with a vertical column layout.
description:
MaMBI’s Good Habits Happy Planner is a discbound option that features goal-setting prompts, trackers, and weekly spreads with a vertical column layout. Happy Planners are much-loved in the planning community for how easy the brand makes it to customize your planner. Thanks to their disc system, you can add, rearrange, and remove planner pages and accessories to make a planner that is uniquely your own.

What makes the Good Habits version stand out is its balanced focus on goal achievement. Each month, you’ll set up your goals and action steps and reflect on your progress from last month. Then, throughout the week, you’ll have small trackers to fill out that rate your daily goal progress from 1 to 3. This makes it really easy to include goal achievement in your planning without taking up any necessary planning space. This planner features a black and gold-foiled botanical design, beige discs, and there are two sizes of the Good Habits version available: Classic (8.75in x 9.75in), and Big (10.1in x 11.5in).
pros: Disc system allows for a ton of personalization without the hassle of a bulky ring binder
Tons of cover designs and disc colors to choose from
Goal management prompts and trackers are thoughtfully included without taking up functional planning space
cons: Happy Planners don’t come with any extra/bonus items, which is rare for planners at their price point
There is only one note page, located at the back of the planner
Some planners are inconsistently labeled, so the planner you buy based on an in-store label may not be the one you intended to bring home
goodToKnow: If you want to add pages to your planner, you’ll need a hole-punch specifically made/sized for these planners.
As mentioned above, Happy Planners only include one note page per planner. They do, however, offer note inserts through their shop.

Also mentioned above, some planners have a label correctly identifying the version of the planner you’re buying. Some, however, don’t—even for the same planner. Both a Classic and Big ‘Good Habits’ vertical Happy Planner were purchased for PlannerDB, yet only one identified itself as the guided version, while the other was labeled as a standard option. If you’re shopping in-store, make sure to flip through the planner before buying.
bottomLine: If you want a goal-achievement planner that doesn’t get in the way of functional planning, then the Good Habits Happy Planner is a great choice. This is especially true if you’re looking for a highly customizable planner or are thinking of switching from a vertical and coiled brand like Erin Condren planners.

name: Annual Planner
tags: weekly horizontal coilbound classic 12-months dated medium 30-50 monday-start 20-30
pageBreakdown: The pages of this Kate Spade New York planner are chic, as to be expected. There is a minimal feel throughout the planner, thanks to its focus on whitespace and limited use of color. The function and form of a Kate Space planner is similar to that of Ban.do’s but with a more grown-up and functional aesthetic.
shortDescription: The Kate Spade NY Annual Planner is a chic and minimal weekly agenda with a horizontal layout.
description: The Kate Spade NY Annual Planner is a chic and minimal weekly agenda with a horizontal layout. The planner also includes a hefty amount of notes pages and monthly calendar spreads alongside the lined weekly layouts. These options are available in a few select cover designs and two sizes (6in x 7.75in, 7.25in x 8.5in) with the same style interior.
pros: Despite coming from a luxury design house, Kate Spade NY planner prices are on-par with (and sometimes less expensive than) competitors
Each monthly dashboard features functional planning space
The included sticker sheets are a mix of functional headers and icons
cons: The built-in folder sleeve are thin, so you’ll need to be delicate to get these to last a full year
The Planner looks the same month after months, so if you more variety in a planner, a different option may be a better fit
Pricing can be inconsistent for the same planner depending on which shop you purchase from
goodToKnow: Each planner design takes one key color to use as an accent throughout the layouts, so you should double-check you like the color before purchasing because you’ll see it—a lot.
Gold-foil details on the outer covers, inside cover, and extra sticker sheet help to give this planner a luxe feel.
These planners are available in both 12-month and 17-month options and two different sizes.
bottomLine: The Kate Spade New York Annual Planner is a great choice if you’ll looking for a minimal and luxe option that is still functional. Even better if you love a planner interior that is consistent and uses a limited range of colors. The horizontal weekly layouts are also lined, so if you prefer blank spacing or vertical layouts, then that’s also something to consider.

name: Daily Planner
tags: weekly horizontal coilbound classic 12-months 12-months-plus dated medium large 30-50 monday-start 20-30
pageBreakdown: This horizontal weekly agenda uses a ton of fun art and colors throughout the 17-month long duration. The daily sections are blank (as opposed to lined), so you can organize your day in a way that best suits you. There are also plenty of lined note pages in this planner found before and after each monthly section, as well as grouped in the back of the notebook.
shortDescription: The Ban.do Daily Planner is a fun, bright, and colorful classic agenda with a horizontal weekly layout.
description:
The Ban.do Daily Planner is a fun, bright, and colorful classic agenda with a horizontal weekly layout. There is a ton of eclectic art throughout the planner, featured on the double-sided monthly dashboard pages. Throughout the functional planning space, only the monthly headers, holidays, and quotes are in color, as Ban.do opts to keep the planning space surprisingly clean and neutral.

The Daily Planner is available in a range of sizes, binding, and designs, all with the same colorful, artsy interior. If coilbound planners are your thing, look for the Daily Planner in medium (6.5in x 8in) or large (10in x 8in). If you like a more compact option, try the hardbound offering, named the ‘Classic’ (5.13in x 8.13).
pros: Includes fun and artsy stickers to spruce up weekly planning
Weekly spreads are blank instead of lined, so you can get more creative
The coilbound and hardcover options are very sturdy and should easily hold up throughout the 17-month duration
cons: The cutesy spreads at the beginning of the planner (and some page headers) could be more useful if they included more functional planning space
The built-in folder pockets are a bit flimsy, so you’ll need to be careful with them to ensure they last
There is no neutral-colored offering, so fans of a minimal style may need to look elsewhere
goodToKnow: All artists featured in the Ban.do Daily Planner are women, and there is a ton of art for/from marginalized artists.
If your preferred design is sold out on Ban.do’s website, you can often find them on their Amazon store.
Currently, you can only find 17-month academic Daily Planners on their site/Amazon. There is no 12-month offering as of yet.
bottomLine: If you want a weekly planner that is creative, colorful, and bright, then this Daily Planner is a great option. The colorful and art-centered pages also have no shortage of functional weekly or monthly planning space, so this planner is the best of both worlds for those who want something fun.

name: Soft Cover Daily
tags: weekly horizontal coilbound classic 12-months dated medium under-20 monday-start
extras: Built-in vertical cardstock folder on the back cover
pageBreakdown: The beginning of the Daily Planner is filled with spreads and pages to help you find your passion, purpose, and vision. Additionally, there are goal and habit tracking pages as well. The rest of the planner is for functional monthly and horizontal weekly planning. The daily pages are broken into lined horizontal sections with a small to-do list at the top next to a mini monthly calendar.
shortDescription: The Bloom Daily planner is a horizontal weekly agenda that blends functional planning with the goal-oriented guided planner style.
description:
If the Happy Planner had a coiled, introspective cousin, it would be a Bloom Planner. This planner puts a feminine spin on traditional guided options and its functional side features lined horizontal weekly spreads. The prompted section is at the beginning of the planner, and everything afterward is for functional planning. If you’re a fan of the journaling and planning sections being separated, then you’ll probably like this structure a lot.

The Daily Planner is currently available in a ton of different cover designs and is bound by a thick (usually gold-toned) coil.
pros: This planner is packed with fun and helpful prompts, and is much less expensive than other guided planners
Very in-depth guided prompts that focus on helping you find your passions and purpose
Bloom includes a unique magnetic bookmark extra as opposed to a snap-in or shrink bookmark
cons: The planner is softbound with a glossy cardstock cover, that may not hold up well by the end of the year compared to their hardbound Vision Planners
The laminated cardstock dividers protrude slightly farther than the cover, making them prone to damage
Doesn’t include as many note pages as other planners
goodToKnow: The Daily Planner has a section to create goals and explore self-discovery in your life right at the beginning of the planner, so if you like to get your prompts out of the way and use the rest for functional planning, this is a great layout for you.
As mentioned above, this planner doesn’t include many note pages, so if you rely on them in your typical planner setup, a different option may be a better fit for you.
If you like the look and feel of the Daily Planner, but prefer a vertical layout, Bloom also offers vertical weekly planners with introspective prompts.
bottomLine: If you’re a fan of guided planner systems but prefer something with more of a feminine touch, then the Bloom Daily Planner could be perfect for you. It can help you achieve your goals and find your 'why' while still being a great functional planner for task and schedule management.

name: Vision Planner
tags: weekly vertical coilbound classic 12-months dated medium 30-50 monday-start
extras: Built-in vertical cardstock folder on the back cover
pageBreakdown: The beginning of the Vision Planner is filled with spreads and pages to help you find your passion, purpose, and vision. While the typical planners from Bloom have similar pages as well, the Vision Planner takes it further by providing monthly previews with a fun self-improvement challenge each month. The rest of the planner is for functional monthly and vertical weekly planning. The daily vertical sections are lined with a blank space at the bottom for notes and a water tracker at the end.
shortDescription: The Bloom Vision planner is a vertical weekly agenda that puts a feminine spin on the traditional minimal guided planner.
description:
If the Happy Planner had a coiled, introspective cousin, it would be the Bloom Vision Planner. This planner puts a feminine spin on traditional guided options and its functional side features lined vertical weekly spreads. On the monthly calendar pages, Bloom provides a fun self-improvement challenge just above a notes column, which adds to this planner’s charm.

The Vision Planner is currently available in four different cover designs: a green botanical, a floral, a pink and marble geometric, and a watercolor and glitter option. Gold foil-tipped corners and a thick matching coil also give this planner a luxe feel, and the covers are sturdy and durable.
pros: The planner feels like a luxe option, but is less expensive than comparable planners
Very in-depth guided prompts that focus on helping you find your passions and purpose
Monthly previews and challenges keep the introspection going throughout the year
cons: The built-in cardstock folder is attached to both the back cover and the coil, so if the folder is overstuffed, it can easily tear from the coil side
Bloom doesn’t offer as many cover designs for the Vision Planner compared to their other coiled planners
Doesn’t include as many note pages as other planners
goodToKnow: The Vision planner has a section to create goals in a wide range of areas in your life each and every month, so if you like to get your prompts out of the way and use the rest for functional only, a different option may be a better fit..
As mentioned above, this planner doesn’t include many note pages, so if you rely on them in your typical planner setup, a different option may be a better fit for you.
If you like the look and feel of the Vision Planner, but prefer a horizontal layout, Bloom also offers horizontal weekly planners with introspective prompts.
bottomLine: If you’re a fan of guided planner systems but prefer something with more of a feminine touch, then the Bloom Vision Planner could be perfect for you. It can help you achieve your goals and find your 'why' while still being a great functional planner for task and schedule management.

name: Original Planner
tags: weekly hourly mixed softbound classic 12-months 6-months dated small medium 30-50 monday-start
pageBreakdown: Inside the Hobonichi Techo Original is a very simple and minimal planner. There is a monthly section with each month back-to-back, and then full-page daily spreads with open layouts. On the left of each daily page is a subtle hourly column that spans from 6 am to 3 am, and on the top right, another subtle section; this time for a checklist. There are also extra pages to keep track of notes, schedules, contacts, and favorite things.
shortDescription: A minimalistic cult classic. This monthly and daily planner has an open grid layout for maximum creativity.
description:
A minimalistic cult classic, the Hobonichi Techo Original planner is a monthly and daily planner with an open grid layout for maximum creativity. This is a classic agenda that almost feels like a bullet journal with its huge amount of free grid space and traditional daily planner features.

Hobonichi Techo planners are very loved for their use of Tomoe River paper, a seriously thin paper that handles a ton of writing tools well with minimal feathering, ghosting, or bleeding. In fact, many Hobonichi loyalists often use watercolors in these planners.

The Original planner comes in A6 (4.1in x 5.9 in) and A5 (5.9in x 8.3in) size (with the larger called the Hobonichi Cousin), and you can find it in black with a textured softcover or cream with a quality cardstock softcover. If you don’t want a single planner for the entire year, you can opt for a two 6-month planner set for a slimmer option.
pros: Available in a typical A5 planner size or in a more compact A6 size
Open daily layouts have a ton of space for creativity
Unique extra pages in the back including a spread for favorite things, graphing spreads for trackers, and gift tracking pages
cons: Due to the softcover design, it’s a good idea to purchase an A6 (or A5 for the Hobonichi Cousin) cover to protect it for a full year of use
Starting at $36, this is one of the more expensive minimal planners on the market
The company doesn’t offer an Original undated, so you will need to wait until either January or April to purchase if you want to use the whole planner
goodToKnow: The Original is typically printed in Japanese, but there are English versions available. If you plan to order one, it’s best to double-check which versions are available.
If you want to try a Hobonichi Techo but it’s after January, the company releases a new one with an April start every Spring.
The planner is a crowd favorite partly due to its use of Tomoe River Paper, an exceptionally thin and soft paper that handles ghosting/bleed very well.
bottomLine: If a classic agenda with unique premium paper, a compact size, and plenty of creative space interests you, then the Hobonichi Techo is a fantastic choice. The Hobonichi Techo works for those who want to paint every inch of their pages, or keep everything minimal and clean, and those in between. It’s a very versatile option that is definitely worth a try if it matches your planning style.

name: Simple Elephant Planner
tags: weekly horizontal guided hardbound classic 12-months undated medium under-20 monday-start
extras: Built-in folder on the back pocket
pageBreakdown: Inside the Simple Elephant planner is a classic agenda with the added bonus of special goal-setting pages in the front. The 12 monthly calendar planning spreads are grouped together in one section, and the weekly spreads are grouped in another, so prepare to flip around a bit. This design is intentional, however, as Papercode wants you to get in the habit of flipping back and forth in order to revisit your goals every so often.
shortDescription: The Simple Elephant is a guided journal for people who hate guided journals. A functional classic agenda with something extra.
description:
Papercode’s Simple Elephant planner is a guided journal for people who hate guided journals. It’s primarily a classic agenda with a balanced emphasis on goal-setting and gratitude that doesn’t get in the way of functional weekly planning. In fact, the majority of the guided section is right at the beginning of the planner. Afterward, you can manage your tasks without interference, except for the weekly ‘successes’ and ‘what I can do better’ sections. These sections sit at the top of the weekly spread, leaving plenty of horizontal space for planning.

This compact hardbound notebook comes in grey, blue, and pink and the cover features a small elephant logo on the bottom left.
pros: Maintains a good balance of introspection and functional planning
Less expensive than other guided planners
1 planner lasts the whole year, as compared to the 3-month standard for other guided planners
cons: Those who love pages packed with questions, check-ins, and prompts maybe find this planner too basic
Not as many color choices available as with other comparable planners
Weekend day planning space is split into much smaller sections compared to the weekdays
goodToKnow: More focus on functionality makes this more of a planner than a guided journal, which can be good or bad depending on your planning style.
Notes pages in the back are lined, so if you’re looking for space for bullet-journal type spreads (habit trackers, mood trackers, etc) then another option may be a better fit.
You can find the Simple Elephant planner on Amazon if Papercode’s site doesn’t have your desired planner in stock.
bottomLine: The Simple Elephant by Papercode might be the best guided-style journal for those who want to test out a prompted planning system. It is inexpensive, lasts the entire year, and mainly features functional layouts found in typical classic agendas.

name: Self Planner
tags: daily mixed guided hardbound 3-months undated medium 30-50 monday-start
extras: Built-in folder on the back pocket
pageBreakdown: The Self Journal is packed with prompts and questions spread throughout the goal-setting, weekly, and daily pages of this planner. What’s unique about this option’s layout is how the day-on-two pages spread includes an hourly 6 am to 9 pm block as well as a full page of empty dot-grid note space to plan your days how you like. With the inclusion of habit tracker as well, this is part guided journal, part classic agenda, and part bullet journal, all in one.
shortDescription: The Self Journal by Best Self is a blend of guided, classic agenda, and bullet journal-style planning in a compact hardbound notebook.
description: The Self Journal by Best Self is a blend of guided, classic agenda, and bullet journal-style planning in a compact hardbound notebook. Primarily, it’s a 3-month guided journal aimed at helping you tackle your quarterly goals while organizing your days. The Self Journal comes in black, navy, coral, and pale yellow.
pros: A goal-setting planner for all types of planning styles since it uses classic hourly layouts, bullet-journal dailies, and guided prompts
Comes with more extras than other similar planners
Includes habit tracking pages
cons: The weekly spread is more geared towards reflection and introspection over planning
Some pages in the journal, like the Benchmarks page, are only helpful if you are using multiple Self Journals per year
If you like the system, you will need to purchase four planners to last throughout the year
goodToKnow: As noted above, the weekly spreads are mainly for goal-setting reflection. If you’re someone who likes to see their week-at-a-glance, then another option may be a better fit.
One of the extras that come with the planner is a fold-out wall poster for goal tracking. The cool part? You can use and reuse it since it works with dry-erase markers.
The daily spreads have guided questions, and hourly planning section, and a full page of dot-grid space so you can get creative and design a layout that works best for you.
bottomLine: The Self Journal by Best Self is a great option for those looking to tackle a big project or quarterly career goals. The flexibility of this planner makes it a great option for several different planning styles and preferences. The questions provided are actually helpful and motivational and further lend themselves to goal achievement. If you’re on the fence about trying a guided journal for the first time, the Self Journal would be a great way to test the system.

name: Classic Standard
tags: daily mixed guided hardbound 3-months undated medium 30-50 monday-start
extras: built-in paper folder on the back cover
Access to closed Full Focus planner Facebook group
pageBreakdown: This quarterly planner is packed from start to finish with questions and activities to get you closer to goal achievement. However, while this planner has tons of prompts for motivation, the planner’s functional side can be a bit confusing. The beginning of the planner is filled with goal setting, rituals, routines, and helps you plan your ‘ideal week’. Interspersed with these, however, is your functional monthly spread. When the functional planning section starts, it begins with each week’s daily spreads before ending with the ‘Weekly Preview’ spread for the past week. Most planners have the weekly spread before the daily, so that makes this planner very unique.
shortDescription: The Full Focus Classic Standard Planner is a quarterly goal-achievement planner packed with questions, tips, and guides to maximize your success.
description:
The Full Focus Classic Standard Planner focuses on quarterly goal-achievement and is packed with questions, tips, and guides to maximize your success. The functional side of this planner consists of a monthly calendar layout, a one-page horizontal weekly orverview, and a day-on-two-pages for the duration of the 3-month planner.

This planner is marketed towards the entrepreneurial type, but can also work well for anyone whose focus is set on project management, goal achievement, or taking control of a busy schedule.

This hardbound planner is a good size at just over 6 by 9 inches and comes in dark grey, beige, or navy blue.
pros: Tons of questions that add focus and motivation to your planning
Sturdy hardbound design makes it durable enough for travel
Includes both lined note pages and grid sketch pages in the back
cons: While the inclusion of two different types of note pages is nice, the planner could use a few more
The planner feels disorganized with monthly, weekly, and daily spreads diverging from a traditional order/layout
This planner is meant to be used in several different sections, but it only comes with two attached ribbon bookmarks
goodToKnow: If you purchase the planner and feel overwhelmed, you can opt to watch their in-depth tutorial videos or get a personalized walkthrough from a planner set-up coach through Full Focus’ website.
If you like the system, you’ll need to buy four of these per year, since the Full Focus Planner lasts for 3 months.

At $40, this is one of the more expensive guided planners on the market, and while it has a ton of goal-setting resources, the price may be difficult to justify for some, with four planners totaling around $160 per year.
bottomLine: If you’re looking for an ultra-thorough guided planner to help you achieve quarterly goals, then this is a good option. However, if you’re more of a fan of the classic agenda set-up, then another option may be a better fit. Overall, this planner is definitely worth a shot if shorter-term guided options are your thing.

name: Weekly Undated
tags: weekly hourly classic guided softbound hardbound 12-months undated medium large 30-50 monday-start
extras: Built-in fabric folder on the back cover
pageBreakdown: The Passion Planner mostly consists of your typical classic agenda pages with monthly and weekly spreads. However, you’ll also find plenty of guided prompts in the monthly review and initial instruction sections.
Fabric folder attached to back cover
shortDescription: The Passion Planner Weekly Undated blends functionality and introspection to help you organize your life in a mindful way.
description:
The Passion Planner Weekly Undated blends functionality and introspection to help you organize your life in a mindful way. This option is a true mashup of a guided journal and classic agenda and it achieves the balance very well, with a highly functional hourly layout for each week, a monthly calendar layout, and an introspective monthly review section.

Available in black, rose gold, purple, champagne, and green, there are plenty of choices and designs to choose from. Plus, if you’re not a fan of the softcover material, Passion Planner offers a black hardbound option as well. Or, if you’d rather go digital, this planner is available for download and use with the Goodnotes app for iPad.
pros: Available in three different sizes (5.8in x 8.3in, 6.9in x 9.8in, and 8.3in x 11.7in)
You can choose whether the planner is a Sunday start or a Monday start when ordering
Passion Planner offers free downloads of their layouts so you can test out the system before purchasing
cons: Only comes with one attached ribbon bookmark, which can make flipping between sections difficult
Digital version not available for testing
While the digital planner can be used on multiple platforms, the main testing and support is mostly for iPad
goodToKnow: As mentioned above, the Passion Planner’s layouts are available as free PDFs to test out the system and see if it works for you before you buy. This is something very few brands offer, and a great opportunity if you’re searching for the perfect planner on a budget.
Passion Planner has a partnership program where, depending on the style of planner you buy, they will give a matching planner to someone in need.
There are several notes pages included in the planner, as a mix of blank and dot-grid note pages.
bottomLine: The Passion Planner Weekly Undated is an awesome choice for someone who wants a mix of insightful journaling alongside their weekly and monthly planning. The planner’s guided section isn’t overbearing or present on every page like other guided planners and leaves plenty of space for functional planning. So, if you’re interested in the style but overwhelmed by other planners that have mindfulness prompts to fill out every day, then this is a great place to start.

name: Weekly and Monthly Planner
tags: weekly horizontal classic hardbound 12-months dated medium 20-30 monday-start
extras: Paper folder attached to the back cover
pageBreakdown: Inside this planner is a classic agenda for monthly and weekly planning. It features a horizontal weekly layout with dashed lines in the writing space. While the weekdays all have their own planning space, weekend days share a single block divided by top banners. For ease of flipping through sections, the planner’s pages are colored on the side to mark each month.
shortDescription: The Lemome Weekly and Monthly Planner is a classic agenda with an artisan feel featuring horizontal weekly spreads and ample note pages.
description:
The Lemome Weekly and Monthly Planner is a classic agenda with an artisan feel featuring horizontal weekly spreads and ample note pages. The exterior features a durable faux-leather front cover, with a fabric and elastic pen loop located on the spine. Inside is a classic horizontal weekly layout for task and schedule management.

What makes this Lemome planner stand out from other classic agendas are the high-quality cover materials and ample note pages provided in the back for creativity and free-writing. This planner is durable and professional and feels underpriced for the quality.
pros: Tons of lined notes pages in the back make this option function as a planner and notebook rolled into one
The exterior’s faux-leather cover and spine give the planner an expensive feel for an affordable price
The monthly and weekly layouts are straightforward with a good amount of functional planning space
cons: The pen loop is located on the spine, making it difficult for larger pens to fit
Paper folder in the back is a bit flimsy and can tear easily if not careful
The included divider tab stickers take up valuable note space on monthly pages
goodToKnow: The weekly planning space lines are dashed, not solid, so if you’re not a fan of dashed detailing, a different option may be a better fit.
Lemome planner pages are resistant to damage from both air and light, so if you leave your planner open next to a sunny window for a while, you shouldn’t experience any discoloring.
The free stickers that come with the planner double as divider tabs, making the planner easier to flip through.
bottomLine: The Lemome Weekly and Monthly Planner is a high-quality classic agenda for the price and a great option that doesn’t feature a ton of feminine design aspects as found in many planners at this price point. The planning space is simple and straightforward, making it a great minimalist or starter option as well.

name: Diary Planner
tags: daily hourly classic hardbound 12-months dated medium under-20 monday-start
extras: Paper folder attached to the back cover
pageBreakdown: Inside this planner is a classic agenda for daily planning. It features a 7 am to 7 pm hourly layout with two solid lines for writing space under each hour. While the weekdays all have their own planning space, each weekend day has a ½ block of space. For ease of flipping through sections, the planner’s equipped with thick sections of paper divider tabs for each month.
shortDescription: The Lemome Dairy Planner is a classic daily planner with a 7 am to 7 pm hourly layout in a professional and durable cover.
description:
While the name of this planner is The Lemome Dairy, it’s not a dated journal, but a classic daily planner with a 7 am to 7 pm hourly layout. The exterior features a durable faux-leather front cover, with a fabric and elastic pen loop located on the spine. Inside is a classic day-on-one-page hourly layout for task and schedule management.

What makes this Lemome planner stand out from other classic agendas are the high-quality cover materials and note pages provided in the back for creativity and free-writing. This planner is durable and professional and feels underpriced for the quality.
pros: The planner comes with paper tab dividers for each month
The exterior’s faux-leather cover and spine give the planner an expensive feel for an affordable price
The daily layouts are straightforward with a good amount of functional planning space
cons: The pen loop is located on the spine, making it difficult for larger pens to fit
Paper folder in the back is a bit flimsy and can tear easily if not careful
The planner lacks traditional monthly calendar pages
goodToKnow: As mentioned above, Lemome swapped traditional monthly calendar pages for a minimal year-on-two-pages layout instead. So, if you’re accustomed to the ample space of a calendar dedicated to each month, then this may be an adjustment.
Lemome planner pages are resistant to damage from both air and light, so if you leave your planner open next to a sunny window for a while, you shouldn’t experience any discoloring.
The pages held up well to the pen test (shown below) compared to others at this price point.
bottomLine: The Lemome Diary Planner is a high-quality classic agenda for the price and a great option that doesn’t feature a ton of feminine design aspects as found in many planners at this price point. The planning space is simple and straightforward, making it a great minimalist or starter option as well.

name: Classic
tags: daily mixed guided hardbound 3-months undated medium 20-30 monday-start
extras: Built-in folder on the back cover
Access to a digital productivity video training series
pageBreakdown: The Panda Planner Classic features three distinct sections: monthly, weekly, and daily. Each section has guided prompts to fill out alongside plenty of blank or lined space for your typical planning needs. Each week features a review of the previous week, plan for next week, and the current week’s goals and projects. Each two-page daily spread features sections for gratitude, excitement, affirmation, daily focus, priorities, schedule, tasks, notes, and an end-of-day review.
Past and future week overview pages
Current week’s tasks and goal pages
shortDescription: The Panda Planner is a comprehensive, guided, short-term daily planner that incorporates research of neuroscience and positive psychology.
description:
The Panda Planner is a comprehensive, guided, short-term daily planner that incorporates research of neuroscience and positive psychology to help you achieve your goals and boost happiness. The exterior is sleek and professional in black or can be fun and colorful in either cyan, orange, or purple.

Aimed at helping you maintain focus and stay on top of your goals, this planner takes a prompted approach for an interactive planning experience throughout the Classic’s 3-month duration. While you plan your days and weeks, expect to revisit your goals while practicing daily gratitude and focusing on affirmations.
pros: The guided prompts and sections are specifically designed to help you reach your goals and boost happiness
Four color options to choose from: cyan, orange, purple, and black
The layouts are undated, so they can be started or stopped whenever
cons: Not the best option for those who just want to manage their daily to-do list or jot down the occasional note
The planner’s 3-month timespan means needing to buy a new planner every quarter if you like the system
The self-focused system means it’s not a great option if you need to manage several busy schedules
goodToKnow: The Panda Planner Classic uses positive psychology-driven prompts to help you focus on wins over losses.
Purchasing the planner also grants access to the Panda Labs Facebook group, to connect you with a supportive and goal-oriented community.
The size at 5.25 x 8.25in makes this a sleek and relatively compact choice that will easily fit in a medium-sized purse or book bag.
bottomLine: If you’re a goal-oriented planner who likes to have a short-term planning outlook, then the Panda Planner Classic is a great choice for you. This is especially true if you want a more introspective agenda that blends the organization of a planner with the self-care experience of a journal. However, if you’re more into simply organizing your day-to-day schedule or manage more than one schedule (think multiple projects, family schedules, etc), then you may want to opt for a classic agenda type planner.

shortDescription: The Panda Planner VIA is a comprehensive, guided, short-term daily planner that helps you use your unique strengths to achieve your goals.
description:
The Panda Planner VIA is a comprehensive, guided, short-term daily planner that helps you use your unique strengths to achieve your goals and boost happiness. The exterior is compact, sleek, and fun with a hardbound cyan cover.

What makes the VIA version stand out from the classic is its focus on helping you find and utilize your own unique core strengths. Aimed at helping you maintain focus and stay on top of your goals, this planner takes a prompted approach for an interactive planning experience throughout the VIA’s 3-month duration. While you plan your days and weeks, expect to revisit your goals while practicing daily gratitude, using your own core strengths, and focusing on affirmations.
pros: The guided prompts and sections are specifically designed to help you reach your goals and boost happiness
The planner can help you will learn your unique core strengths and how to use them to achieve goals

goodToKnow: The Panda Planner VIA helps you discover your own character strengths and blends them with the positive-psychology methods found in the Classic version to help you reach your goals and discover more about yourself.

bottomLine: If you’re a goal-oriented and introspective planner who likes to have a short-term planning outlook, then the Panda Planner VIA is a great choice for you. This is especially true if you want a more reflective agenda that blends the organization of a planner with the self-care experience of a journal. However, if you’re more into simply organizing your day-to-day schedule or manage more than one schedule (think multiple projects, family/kid schedules, etc), then you may want to opt for a classic agenda type planner.

name: Weekly 2.0
tags: weekly mixed classic hardbound 12-months undated medium under-20 monday-start
extras: Built-in folder on the back cover
Access to a digital productivity video training series
pageBreakdown: The Panda Planner Weekly 2.0 features two simple sections: monthly and weekly. This planner is definitely the most straightforward that Panda offers, as it’s in a classic agenda format instead of their typical guided/journal style. The Weekly 2.0 is a great minimalistic and to-the-point option for those who like the look of the Panda brand, but aren’t big on prompts and questions.
shortDescription: The Panda Planner Weekly 2.0 is a weekly classic-agenda style planner with a compact spiral-bound exterior.
description:
The Panda Planner Weekly 2.0 is a weekly classic-agenda style planner with a compact spiral-bound exterior. Unlike the typically guided planners from this brand, this one is a true classic agenda that focuses on structure and organization over interactivity.

The planner is relatively thin, at just under a ½ inch thick including both covers and the included snap-in folder, and includes a hard plastic cover on the front and back.
pros: The planner is undated so it can be started at any point during the year.
The hard plastic covers are very durable and come in a variety of colors: pink, purple, or black.
For those that prefer dated planners, there is one dated Weekly 2.0 option with a dark grey cover.
cons: Not the best option for those looking for an interactive and introspective planner
The monthly and weekly layouts feel very simple compared to competitors
The planner’s inexpensive cover material and coil make the planner feel a bit overpriced.
goodToKnow: This option is very simple and less expensive than the other Panda Planners, so it’s a great choice if you just want to give planning a try.
Purchasing the planner also grants access to the Panda Labs Facebook group, to connect you with a supportive and goal-oriented community.
The size at 5.75 x 8.25in makes this a relatively compact choice that will easily fit in a medium-sized purse or book bag.
bottomLine: If you’re looking for a good starter planner that has fewer frills, then the Weekly 2.0 is a great choice. There is a section on each weekday for a daily highlight and daily gratitude, but these sections feel a bit lackluster compared to Panda Planner’s other offerings, and take up space that could be better used for planning or free space. Overall, a decent planner for someone just starting out, but there are more stylish and comprehensive options at this price point from other brands.

name: Weekly Pro Planner
tags: weekly mixed guided softbound 12-months undated large 30-50 monday-start
extras: Paper folder attached to the back cover
pageBreakdown: The planner does feel a bit bulky because, in addition to its letter-sized prompted goal-setting, monthly, and weekly spreads, Clever Fox also includes a hefty amount of dotted grid pages for creative space in the back. The spreads are all grouped together, so you will find the goal setting pages in one section, then monthly, weekly, and notes. Luckily, the planner comes with three ribbon bookmarks, so you’ll be able to jump from section to section with ease.
shortDescription: The Weekly Pro is a guided, weekly, 12-month planner full of fun and insightful prompts to help you meet your goals.
description:
The Clever Fox Weekly Pro Planner is a guided, weekly, 12-month planner full of fun and insightful prompts to help you meet your goals and stay on track. In addition to being a powerhouse option for achievers, this planner is very sleek. The exterior features a durable softbound cover with a chic minimal fox design. The covers also come in a TON of colors, so chances are, they’ll have yours.

What makes this planner stand out from other guided options is its focus on self-discovery. From the insightful prompted questions to the spacious vision board pages, it’s those little details that not only make this a highly functional option but one that can make you excited to plan. And in the case of this planner, more planning = getting closer to your goals.
pros: Sleek design with little details that make the planner feel like a luxe-yet-functional option
Heavily focuses on self-discovery alongside goal-setting make this a very introspective planner
There are so many dot-grid note pages in the back, that it almost feels like you’re getting a free bullet journal with your purchase
cons: If you’re used to more compact planners (think A5 size and smaller) then this letter-sized option will take some getting used to
While the softbound cover is fairly durable, it may not hold up for the entire year of use
The paper folder attached to the back cover is a bit delicate and can rip easily if not careful
goodToKnow: As mentioned above, the softbound cover doesn’t seem like it will make it through a full year of heavy use unless you keep it in one place and rarely move it. Clever Fox probably made the decision to opt for a soft binding over hard to cut down on the weight of this option, but the trade-off is in its lasting power.
The planner comes with an illustrated tips/instruction booklet full of inspiration to give you a boost in creativity.
If you try and it and it just doesn’t work for you, the company will offer a full refund within 60 days of purchase.
bottomLine: Clever Fox has done with their planners what few of their competitors have done so far—blending chic, professional design that you want to show off with highly functional spreads that really do help you stay on track and take control of your days. If you’re looking for an option to help you connect with yourself and find your ‘why’, complete an important project, and/or focus on your career, then this is a fantastic option.

shortDescription: The Ultimate Achiever’s Planner is a guided planner full of fun and insightful prompts to help you meet your goals.
description:
The Clever Fox Ultimate Achiever’s Planner is a 13-week guided planner full of fun and insightful prompts to help you meet your goals and stay on track. In addition to being a powerhouse option for achievers, this planner is beautiful. The exterior features a soft-yet-sturdy hardbound cover with a chic metallic fox design. The covers also come in the following colors: rose gold, navy, teal, onyx, red, pearl, and pink.

What makes this planner stand out from other guided options is its attention to detail. From the luxe packaging to the interactive spreads, the Ultimate Achiever’s planner was clearly made with care and attention. It’s those little details that not only make this a highly functional option but one that can make you excited to plan. And in the case of this planner, more planning = getting closer to your goals.
pros: Sleek design with little details that make the planner feel like a luxe-yet-functional option
The daily spreads have plenty of space for functional planning, including an hourly (5 am to 10 pm) schedule section
Two of the attached ribbon bookmarks are labeled ‘today’ and ‘week’, which makes flipping through sections even easier
cons: The planner only spans 13-weeks, or around 3-months, so those who like the system will need to purchase four of these planners per year
The paper folder attached to the back cover is a bit delicate and can tear easily if not careful
The included digital extras are lacking compared to competitors. Clever fox offers instructions to contact them, while competitors often offer videos or short courses
goodToKnow: This planner is meant to be used at least 3x a day: once for morning routine planning, once for daily schedule/tasks, and once more for an evening review.
The attached pen loop is sturdy and sewed—not glued—onto the back cover and can handle your fattest or heaviest pens.
If you try and it and it just doesn’t work for you, the company will offer a full refund within 60 days of purchase.
bottomLine: Clever Fox has done with this planner what few of their competitors have done so far—blending chic, professional design that you want to show off with highly functional spreads that really do help you stay on track and take control of your days. If you’re looking for an option to help you complete an important project or focus on your career, then this is a fantastic option.
